This led to the global emergence of "Gond painting," though many insist on calling it "Jangarh Kalam" to honor its individual creator and revolutionary style.

The sentence is for leading an attempted coup in 2022. Federal police acted on a Supreme Court directive. Bolsonaro was moved from his residence to police headquarters.

The service aims to preserve the initial bond between parent and child, a trend embraced by other celebrities.

description: Singer Ciara revealed on the 'Angie Martinez IRL' podcast that her husband, Russell Wilson, despite being younger, acts as an emotional anchor due to his 'old soul' and maturity. She finds his grounded demeanor provides stability amidst NFL pressures and fame.  Ciara emphasized his 'fullness as a man' enriches their strong partnership.

title: ‘We grew marijuana for the British’: Kunal Ganjawala reveals how he got his surname, says ‘lagaan maaf tha’ as they were ‘licensed druggists’

'We won't shut down': Al-Falah University assures worried parents; campus under ED lens
description: Al-Falah University assures parents it won't close amid regulatory probes and financial investigations. The Enforcement Directorate is probing alleged fund diversion and financial irregularities, leading to the arrest of the group's chairman. The university addressed a NAAC notice regarding outdated accreditation on its website, calling it an oversight.

title: Kannada star Dr Rajkumar sang ‘Bheege Honth Tere’ at 75 despite not knowing Hindi, recalls Kunal Ganjawala; passed away a few months later
Hold your breath! 'Air-mergency' of living in one of the world’s most polluted cities
description: Millions in India's capital face a persistent health hazard from air pollution, with sustained high levels of PM2.5 linked to severe respiratory, cardiovascular, and neurological damage.  This daily reality, especially during winter smog, significantly reduces life expectancy and disproportionately affects vulnerable populations, demanding systemic emission control.

'Will Rahul get msg?': BJP on Tharoor's Trump-Mamdani remark; calls Cong 'sore loser'
description: The BJP has questioned Rahul Gandhi's receptiveness to democratic cooperation after Shashi Tharoor lauded US political civility. Tharoor's post, advocating for post-election unity for national interest, drew a sharp retort from BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawala, who questioned if Gandhi would heed the message and avoid acting like 'sore losers'.

title: Ashes: Chasing Tendulkar's all-time record, Root flops again in Australia
description: Joe Root endured a disappointing start to the Ashes 2025 in Perth, failing to score in the first innings and managing only eight in the second, with Mitchell Starc claiming his wicket on both occasions. Despite his stellar career record, Root has historically struggled in Australia. Travis Head's century secured an eight-wicket victory for Australia in the first Test.

Watch: PM Modi on charm offensive at G20; shares laugh with Meloni, hugs world leaders
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's candid conversation with Italian PM Giorgia Meloni captured attention at the G20 Summit sidelines in Johannesburg. The Indian Prime Minister also shared warm embraces with other world leaders, including Brazil's President Lula da Silva. Modi's arrival was marked by a vibrant cultural welcome from a troupe and the Indian diaspora.

title: 'Aisa dalega toh... ': Captain Pant backs Kuldeep with cheeky message - watch
description: Rishabh Pant captained India on Day 1 of the second Test, his vocal encouragement from behind the stumps becoming a highlight.  Viral stump-mic moments captured his active role in motivating bowlers and setting the tone.  Despite South Africa reaching a strong position, Pant's energetic leadership offered a glimpse into his captaincy style, balancing instinct and calmness.

description: Yashasvi Jaiswal's remarkable Test career continues with a unique record of never playing on the same ground twice. From his debut century in Dominica to recent double hundreds against England, he has consistently adapted to diverse conditions. Despite a recent struggle in South Africa, Jaiswal's impressive statistics highlight his potential.

These communication habits can make you highly likable at work, says expert
description: People who are widely liked at work often rely on subtle communication habits that shape how others perceive their warmth and professionalism. Small behaviours, from a sincere greeting to confident vocal inflection, can strengthen rapport and build credibility. Experts note that making time for small talk and recognising when to step back from disengaged conversations also deepens trust and improves workplace relationships.

Greater Noida: Woman jumps to death from 16th floor apartment
description: A 21-year-old woman, Shalu from Muzaffarnagar, tragically died after allegedly jumping from the 16th floor of a Greater Noida residential building on Friday evening. The incident occurred at Migsun Twin Society, with police stating no suicide note was found and investigations are ongoing.

description: Google CEO Sundar Pichai has cautioned employees about an "intense" 2026, citing fierce AI competition and surging cloud demand. He addressed concerns about an AI investment bubble, emphasizing that underinvesting poses greater risks. Pichai assured staff of Google's strong financial footing and superior positioning to navigate market volatility and competitive pressures.

title: 'Babri foundation in WB on Dec 6': TMC MLA says mosque will take '3 yrs to complete'
description: A TMC MLA's announcement to lay a foundation stone for a "Babri Masjid" in West Bengal's Murshidabad on December 6 has sparked controversy. The BJP has slammed the move as "appeasement politics," while the Congress has distanced itself, emphasizing governance issues. This is not the first time the MLA has made such a statement.

'Did 8 peace deals': Trump repeats role in India-Pakistan ceasefire
description: US President Donald Trump again claimed credit for easing India-Pakistan tensions, stating he brokered peace deals and that PM Modi assured him of no war. India, however, consistently dismisses third-party mediation, with the conflict stemming from Operation Sindoor following a deadly attack. Trump's claims come as he met with New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani.

Dubai Tejas crash: Pilot Namansh Syal seen smiling with officials before tragedy – video
description: An Indian Air Force Tejas fighter jet crashed during an aerobatic display at the Dubai Airshow on Friday, resulting in the death of pilot Wing Commander Namansh Syal. The aircraft reportedly failed to recover from a negative-G turn, plunging to the ground and erupting in flames. This marks the second crash of the Tejas fighter since its induction.

OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to employees in internal memo: Google’s AI success can create…
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledged Google's AI advancements could temporarily impact the company, but expressed confidence in catching up.  Despite ChatGPT's user engagement cooling, Altman urged employees to focus on achieving superintelligence, emphasizing OpenAI's strength to navigate competition from rivals like Google and Anthropic, even as Google benefits from cloud services.

title: LiAngelo Ball Goes Platinum with Breakout Hit “Tweaker” Featuring Drake
description: LiAngelo Ball, formerly a basketball player, has achieved a major milestone in music. His debut single 'Tweaker' has gone platinum. This success signifies a significant crossover from sports to the entertainment industry. The song became a cultural phenomenon, embraced by sports teams and charting highly. Ball's journey redefines his public identity and highlights his artistic ambition.
